00008 #define CLOCKID CLOCK_REALTIME
00009 #define SIG SIGRTMIN
00010 
00011 #define errExit(msg)    do { perror(msg); exit(EXIT_FAILURE);   \
00012   } while (0)
00013 
00014 static void
00015 print_siginfo(siginfo_t *si)
00016 {
00017   timer_t *tidp;
00018   int or;
00019 
00020   tidp = si->si_value.sival_ptr;
00021 
00022   printf("    sival_ptr = %p; ", si->si_value.sival_ptr);
00023   printf("    *sival_ptr = 0x%lx\n", (long) *tidp);
00024 
00025   or = timer_getoverrun(*tidp);
00026   if (or == -1)
00027     errExit("timer_getoverrun");
00028   else
00029     printf("    overrun count = %d\n", or);
00030 }
00031 
00032 static void
00033 handler(int sig, siginfo_t *si, void *uc)
00034 {
00035   /* Note: calling printf() from a signal handler is not
00036      strictly correct, since printf() is not async-signal-safe;
00037      see signal(7) */
00038 
00039   printf("Caught signal %d\n", sig);
00040   print_siginfo(si);
00041   signal(sig, SIG_IGN);
00042 }
00043 
00044 int
00045 main(int argc, char *argv[])
00046 {
00047   timer_t timerid;
00048   struct sigevent sev;
00049   struct itimerspec its;
00050   long long freq_nanosecs;
00051   sigset_t mask;
00052   struct sigaction sa;
00053 
00054   if (argc != 3) {
00055     fprintf(stderr, "Usage: %s <sleep-secs> <freq-nanosecs>\n",
00056             argv[0]);
00057     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00058   }
00059 
00060   /* Establish handler for timer signal */
00061 
00062   printf("Establishing handler for signal %d\n", SIG);
00063   sa.sa_flags = SA_SIGINFO;
00064   sa.sa_sigaction = handler;
00065   sigemptyset(&sa.sa_mask);
00066   if (sigaction(SIG, &sa, NULL) == -1)
00067     errExit("sigaction");
00068 
00069   /* Block timer signal temporarily */
00070 
00071   printf("Blocking signal %d\n", SIG);
00072   sigemptyset(&mask);
00073   sigaddset(&mask, SIG);
00074   if (sigprocmask(SIG_SETMASK, &mask, NULL) == -1)
00075     errExit("sigprocmask");
00076 
00077   /* Create the timer */
00078 
00079   sev.sigev_notify = SIGEV_SIGNAL;
00080   sev.sigev_signo = SIG;
00081   sev.sigev_value.sival_ptr = &timerid;
00082   if (timer_create(CLOCKID, &sev, &timerid) == -1)
00083     errExit("timer_create");
00084 
00085   printf("timer ID is 0x%lx\n", (long) timerid);
00086 
00087   /* Start the timer */
00088 
00089   freq_nanosecs = atoll(argv[2]);
00090   its.it_value.tv_sec = freq_nanosecs / 1000000000;
00091   its.it_value.tv_nsec = freq_nanosecs % 1000000000;
00092   its.it_interval.tv_sec = its.it_value.tv_sec;
00093   its.it_interval.tv_nsec = its.it_value.tv_nsec;
00094 
00095   if (timer_settime(timerid, 0, &its, NULL) == -1)
00096     errExit("timer_settime");
00097 
00098   /* Sleep for a while; meanwhile, the timer may expire
00099      multiple times */
00100 
00101   printf("Sleeping for %d seconds\n", atoi(argv[1]));
00102   sleep(atoi(argv[1]));
00103 
00104   /* Unlock the timer signal, so that timer notification
00105      can be delivered */
00106 
00107   printf("Unblocking signal %d\n", SIG);
00108   if (sigprocmask(SIG_UNBLOCK, &mask, NULL) == -1)
00109     errExit("sigprocmask");
00110 
00111   exit(EXIT_SUCCESS);
00112 }
